strapiPost.title: Building Permits for Single-Family Homes Up 21%
strapiPost.content:
Residential building permit activity in Northwest Arkansas saw a significant increase of 21% through the first seven months of 2023 compared to last year, indicating a thriving housing market in the region.

Jumping ahead: Data collected by the Northwest Arkansas Business Journal revealed Bentonville, Fayetteville, Rogers, and Springdale issued a total of 1,099 residential building permits through July — a notable jump from the 908 permits issued during the same period in 2022.

Tracking Growth: Bentonville led the pack with 376 permits issued through July, up 18.9% from the previous year of 316. Rogers issued 237, a 39.4% increase over last year’s 170. Springdale issued 210 permits, a 112.1% increase over just 99 last year.

Find more details in Talk Business & Politics HERE.
